message.content:
cs.DC, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with designing mechanisms for reliable task computing systems over the Internet, which is a topic that falls under the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses the different types of workers in such systems and how to induce truthful behavior in rational workers, which falls under the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper also deals with reputation-based mechanisms to cope with malicious workers, which falls under the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The paper also discusses the trade-offs between various metrics and parameters, which falls under the Game Theory (cs.GT) sub-category. Finally, the paper evaluates the reputation schemes against the tolerance to cheaters, which falls under the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
